name: Mercury(II) oxide
desc: Mercury(II) oxide, also called mercuric oxide or simply mercury oxide, has a formula of HgO. It has a red or orange color. Mercury(II) oxide is a solid at room temperature and pressure. The mineral form montroydite is very rarely found.
Solubility: insoluble in alcohol, ether, acetone, ammonia
EU classification (DSD) (outdated):
Very toxic (T+)
Dangerous for the environment (N)
Other anions:
Mercury sulfide
Mercury selenide
Mercury telluride
